page.title: 08FARMING - LIVESTOCK
page.content: At Braceby there is a flock of{600 {breeding mule ewes}bought annually from Yorkshire. They are kept on permanent grass during summer but are kept indoors from November to April. In January they are sheared, each fleece weighing 4lb(2kg). This is collected by a local merchant, graded then sent to British Wool Marketing Board. The ewes are served by ten Suffolk rams in October to lamb in March when they have l.8 lambs per ewe These are weaned after l2 weeks, fattened and sold from July to October either at Grantham or Stamford Market or to a local butcher. The Sapperton flock of{400 half breed ewes(Border {Leicester/Suffolk)}are looked after by a free lance shepherd who is responsible for taking them on to neighbouring farmers' sugar beet tops for the winter.
